subject: Self Care
title: The 21-Day Myth
description: A quick win: understand The 21-Day Myth.

hook.text: Self-help books say habits form in 21 days. Science says the real number is closer to 66 â€” on average.

buildup.text: The myth came from a misquoted 1960s study on plastic surgery patients adjusting to their new faces.

discovery.text: University College London found habit formation takes 18 to 254 days. Complexity determines the timeline.

twist.text: Missing a single day didn't derail habit formation. Consistency matters more than perfection.

climax.text: Don't count days. Count repetitions. The habit arrives when the action feels automatic, not on a calendar date.

punchline.text: Forget 21 days. Just keep showing up daily.
